title_sort: reuben farwell to walt whitman, 16 june 1864
title: Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 16 June 1864
text: Washington City D.CThursday Eve June 16thDear Comrad[Comrade]I arrived in Town this forenoon and I have been trying to find your residence But unseccessfull[unsuccessful] I came to Armory Suqare[Square] Hospital to learn whither you had gone The Boys do not know your whereabouts. SSo I concluded to find out by dropping a few lines to youI hope my Dear Uncle that nothing has befallen you Either sickness or discontentmentI would like to see you before I returne[return] to The Front which will be on the 18th of this month. To morrow night I will remain here If you have any desire or wish to see me Call or write me your address I just come from the front & Expect to return soonreceive this from one who remembers you stillYours Affectionately Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 16 June 1864
